intro: Impatiens razanatsoa-charlei, commonly known as the Madagascar impatiens, is a species native to the island of Madagascar. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Balsaminaceae family, characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are usually borne in clusters and bloom throughout the wet season, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions.
